head.supplied: Melbourne botanic Garden, ¶ 24/3/71 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to acknowledge receipt of your circular, N969, ¶ and I shall prepare at once for the honorable the Commissioner of public Works a state...

div.p: Z71/3750, unit 576, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
I have the honor to acknowledge receipt of your circular, N969,
get copy from outward - in fact indexes for 1871 outwards probably have not been checked at PRO. See SM's notes to where she got up to.
and I shall prepare at once for the honorable the Commissioner of public Works a statement of the public works required for the botanic Garden during the coming financial year; but before sending in my statement it would be necessary for me to learn whether my last requisitions for public works, except that for the large tank,
See M to J. McCulloch, 17 February 1871 (in this edition as 71-02-17a). are likely to receive the approval of the hon. the Chief Secretary.
M's request for additional public works in M to J. McCulloch, 25 March 1871 (in this edition as 71-03-25c) was sent after 'having received information that my [previous ] requestions for public works … have received your approval'. A written notice to this effect has not been found.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be Sir, your obedient servant

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
